title: [Large-scale] Reflective Dialogue Learning Design for Multicultural Teacher Education

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of multicultural education fundamentals and foundational awareness of social equity issues
context.additional_context: Learners operate in a smartphone-based restricted technology environment and undergo comprehensive multicultural education competency assessments through project-based evaluations.

learning_goals: Learners can recognize their cultural biases in multicultural educational contexts and reflect through reflective journaling

Learners engage in a 15-minute discussion with two peer teachers on three cultural cases (e.g., holidays, traditional clothing, food), present opinions using ≥2/3 provided analytical frameworks (cultural background, social impact, personal experience), and provide feedback respecting peers' perspectives.

Over 2–4 weeks, learners design two immediately applicable teaching strategies for multicultural education settings (classrooms, community centers) via team projects (3–5 members), validate practicality through peer evaluation (≥3 peers) and teacher verification (≥4/5 rubric items met).

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
